com.shopgun.android.sdk.shoppinglists

Class SyncManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shopgun.android.sdk.shoppinglists.SyncManager
  • Deprecated. 
    No longer maintained The SyncManager class performs asynchronous synchronization with the ShopGun API, to propagate all Shoppinglist and ShoppinglistItem changes that a user may have done in the database.

    Notifications about Shoppinglist and ShoppinglistItem changes, are relayed through the subscriber system in the ListManager.

    There are four types of synchronization that will be performed:

    • Local changes - Sending local changes to the API has precedence over the other types of synchronization.
    • Shoppinglist.getModified() - This is the default action, this will be performed if no other type of synchronization is chosen. This in practice means that this will be performed on almost every iteration. If there is any changes in the modified, both the Shoppinglist and it's ShoppinglistItems will be synchronized.
    • Shoppinglist - Shoppinglists will be performed on every 3rd iteration the SyncManager does. As there are less chance of adding, and removing Shoppinglists than that of having a change to an existing Shoppinglist (which will be handled by the synchronization option above.
    • Full sync loop - The full sync loop is performed on every 10th iteration, and ensures that the state is completely up to date. The local state can become decoupled from the server state in certain situations, where we are not able to determine and fix the situation in any other way, e.g.: If two devices makes a change to a list at the exact same second, and both devices therefore has a valid/correct modified.

    When LifecycleManager calls destroy, all local pending changes are pushed to the API if possible to ensure a correct state on the server (and other devices).


    @Deprecated
public class SyncManager
extends java.lang.Object

      • hasFirstSync

        public boolean hasFirstSync()
        Deprecated. 
        Method for determining if the first sync cycle to the API is done.
        Returns:
        True if the first sync is complete, or there is no user to sync.

      • forceSync

        public void forceSync()
        Deprecated. 
        Method for forcing a new synchronization iteration.

        This method will trigger the synchronization loop, so it's essentially also the method for starting the SyncManager sync loop

        This method should only be used in special cases, as the synchronization is (within reasonably time intervals) being handled automatically by the SyncManager

      • setSyncInterval

        public void setSyncInterval(int time)
        Deprecated. 
        Set synchronization interval for Shoppinglist, and ShoppinglistItem. The speed must be a value defined in SyncInterval.
        Parameters:
        time - A synchronization interval in milliseconds

      • getSyncInterval

        public int getSyncInterval()
        Deprecated. 
        Get the current sync interval
        Returns:
        The sync interval in milliseconds

      • setMigrateOfflineLists

        public void setMigrateOfflineLists(boolean migrate)
        Deprecated. 
        Method for easily migrating "offline" lists to "online" lists.

        If true, the SyncManager ensures the merging of any (non-empty) "offline" lists, into a new "online" user's shoppinglists, on the first completed sync cycle.

        (a user is considered a "new" if he/she haven't got any lists on the server already)

        Parameters:
        migrate - true if to do automatic migration of offline shoppinglists, else false

      • isMigratingOfflineLists

        public boolean isMigratingOfflineLists()
        Deprecated. 
        True if "offline" Shoppinglist will be migrated on first sync with a new "online" user's shoppinglists.
        Returns:
        true if the SyncManager will migrate any offline lists, else false
